text: Hey everyone and welcome to this week's
news and community spotlights. We were
incredibly proud to see that more than
half of over 50 games showcased during
last month's Summer GameFest live stream
were powered by Unreal Engine. We
reached out to some of those making a
big splash, including Out of Words, End
of Abyss, Infantessimal, Ill, and Felt
That Boxing to ask them why they chose
UE5 for their games and how it enabled
them to achieve their goals. Get
inspired with a full interview at
unrealeng engine.com/feed.
Wildgate, the debut title from Dream
Haven's Moonshot Games, is an
action-packed PvP adventure that
immerses players in a sci-fi universe.
Developed using UE5, it invites players
to cruise starships, explore alien
ruins, and compete for powerful
artifacts in a chaotic and playful
environment. Drawing inspiration from
classics like Star Wars and Star Trek,
as well as elements from Saturday
morning cartoons, the game aims to
create a sense of wonder and challenge,
the team at Moonshot focuses on ensuring
that every member could contribute
creatively to the project, resulting in
a dynamic and engaging space combat
sandbox where players leave each session
with memorable stories from their
adventures. Learn about their processes
on the feed.
Visit online serviceservices
epicgames.com to learn how matchmaking
has evolved to dynamic systems using
PubNob and Epic online services.
Considering factors like play style and
social connections for a more
personalized gaming experience.
Ready to get a little bot crazy? With
the release of the new and improved
Stackbot sample, we've launched a new
contest. Learn new skills and compete
for prizes as an individual in the mega
stacko jam. Get all the details on how
to register on the feed.
Join your local chapter to grow, learn,
and be inspired. Here are upcoming
events to check out.
Now for this week's community
spotlights. Welcome to Bob's Botarium by
Phil Bose. A cozy yet intriguingly
secluded spot filled with cats and
vibrant plants. While the atmosphere may
seem inviting, Bob has deliberately left
the only bridge across the swamp in
disrepair, ensuring nobody can enter.
Shield journeyed into this creative and
stylized project, utilizing UEI5's PCG
system, Blender, and Justin Wallace's
environment artist survival kit to gain
new experiences in stylized art. You can
find more of Shield's work on their art
station.
3D environment artist Elliot Kuraba has
created a stunning winter scene set in a
remote mountain weather station titled
Frozen Outpost. Inspired by Maxim Doro,
he utilized procedural modeling in
Houdini and Maya to create the outpost
with easy fog and easy snow by William
Focher to aid in crafting an enhanced
atmosphere that provides striking
immersion to the loneliness of the
building within its environment.
The last spotlight of the week is the
masterfully sculpted Lenora, Queen of
Crows by Sergio Kazov. Inspired by
Soulslike games and Gothic aesthetics,
Sergio pushed the boundaries in concept
development, composition, visual
storytelling, and gesture design using
ZBrush, Substance, and Unreal Engine to
do it.
Thank you so much for watching. I'll
catch you next time.
